subject: Politics
title: Cosmopolitanism vs Nationalism
description: A micro-lesson that makes Cosmopolitanism vs Nationalism usable.

hook.text: Are you a citizen of your country or of the world? Cosmopolitans and nationalists offer opposite answers.

buildup.text: Cosmopolitanism says moral obligations extend to all humans equally, regardless of borders or nationality.

discovery.text: Nationalists argue that shared culture, history, and identity create special bonds that justify putting nation first.

twist.text: Climate change, pandemics, and migration demand global cooperation. But voters keep choosing nationalist leaders.

climax.text: The tension between global problems and national politics defines the 21st century's central political challenge.

punchline.text: Global problems need global answers. National politics keeps blocking them.

quiz.question: What does cosmopolitanism argue about moral obligations?
options: They extend equally to all humans regardless of national borders
They only apply to citizens of your own country
They only matter during international conflicts
